item.title: Site Setup
item.description: This page covers the initial steps to create two GitHub repositories, configure Hugo with the Docsy theme, and set up the basic configuration file.

item.title: Deploying the site on Netlify
item.description:
Step 1: Preparing the repositories

  1. Make sure your Hugo site code is hosted in a GitHub repository.
  2. The public repository should only contain generated files (e.g., from the public/ directory).

Step 2: Create a new project on Netlify

  1. Go to Netlify and sign up or log in.
  2. Click on the “New Site from Git” button.
  3. Connect your GitHub account with Netlify and select the appropriate repository.
  4. In the settings, specify the build command: hugo and the publish directory: public.

Step 3: Environment variables

Add environment variables if needed (e.g., for API keys or other settings).
